greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of Product_{i>=1} (1-x^i)^(1/i); also of exp(- Sum_{n>=1}(d(n)*x^n/n)) where d(n) is the number of divisors of n.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..445
mathematica: nmax = 50; CoefficientList[Series[Product[(1 - x^k)^(1/k), {k, 1, nmax}], {x, 0, nmax}], x]*Range[0, nmax]! (* _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 24 2016 *)
a[ n_] := If[n < 0, 0, n! SeriesCoefficient[ Exp[ -Sum[DivisorSigma[0, k] x^k/k, {k, n}]], {x, 0, n}]]; (* _Michael Somos_, Nov 25 2016 *)
results.author: _Jeffrey Shallit_
